trans-unit.source: Defines a geometric shape, described using a <xref href="System.Windows.Media.StreamGeometryContext"></xref>.
This geometry is light-weight alternative to <xref href="System.Windows.Media.PathGeometry"></xref>: it does not support data binding, animation, or modification.
Use a StreamGeometry when you need to describe a complex geometry but do not want the overhead of supporting data binding, animation, or modification.
Because of its efficiency, the StreamGeometry class is a good choice for describing adorners.
A StreamGeometry cannot be serialized if it contains a <xref:System.Windows.Media.Transform> or any non-stroked or unfilled segments.
Freezable Features A StreamGeometry is a <xref:System.Windows.Freezable> type.
For information about <xref:System.Windows.Freezable> features, such as freezing and cloning, see the [Freezable Objects Overview](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
## XAML Attribute Usage ``` ``` ## XAML Values *moveAndDrawCommands* One or more move and draw commands.
See [Path Markup Syntax](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
Initializes a new, empty instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.StreamGeometry"></xref> class.
Gets a <xref href="System.Windows.Rect"></xref> that is exactly large enough to contain this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.StreamGeometry"></xref>.
This method does not take any pen into account when calculating the geometry's bounds.
The bounding box of this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.StreamGeometry"></xref>.
Removes all geometric information from this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.StreamGeometry"></xref>.
Creates a modifiable clone of this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.StreamGeometry"></xref>, making deep copies of this object's values.
When copying dependency properties, this method copies resource references and data bindings (but they might no longer resolve) but not animations or their current values.
This method is used to produce modifiable copies of frozen <xref:System.Windows.Freezable> objects (or any <xref:System.Windows.Freezable> object).
For convenience, this method shadows the inherited version with a strongly typed implementation.
For more information, see <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.Clone%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.
A modifiable clone of the current object.

The cloned object's <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen*> property will be <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref> even if the source's <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen*> property was <xref uid="langword_csharp_true." name="true." href=""></xref>
To be added.
Creates a modifiable clone of this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.StreamGeometry"></xref> object, making deep copies of this object's current values.
Resource references, data bindings, and animations are not copied, but their current values are.
This method is used to produce modifiable copies of frozen <xref:System.Windows.Freezable> objects (or any <xref:System.Windows.Freezable> object).
For convenience, this method shadows the inherited version with a strongly typed implementation.
For more information, see <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.CloneCurrentValue%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.
A modifiable clone of the current object.

The cloned object's <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen*> property will be <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref> even if the source's <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen*> property was <xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref>.
To be added.
To be added.
Gets or sets a value that determines how the intersecting areas contained in this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.StreamGeometry"></xref> are combined.

**EvenOdd** Determines the "insideness" of a point on the shape by drawing a ray from that point to infinity in any direction and counting the number of path segments from the given shape that the ray crosses.
If this number is odd, the point is inside; if even, the point is outside.

**NonZero** Determines the "insideness" of a point on the shape by drawing a ray from that point to infinity in any direction and then examining the places where a segment of the shape crosses the ray.
Starting with a count of zero, add one each time a Segment crosses the ray from left to right and subtract one each time a path segment crosses the ray from right to left.
After counting the crossings, if the result is zero then the point is outside the path.
Otherwise, it is inside.

![Fill rule illustration](~/add/media/ref-mil-fillrule-stars.PNG "Fill rule illustration") FillRule Example ## Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|| |Metadata properties set to `true`|None|
Indicates how the intersecting areas of this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.StreamGeometry"></xref> are combined.
The default value is `EvenOdd`.
Identifies the <xref:System.Windows.Media.StreamGeometry.FillRule*> dependency property.
To be added.
To be added.
To be added.
Determines whether this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.StreamGeometry"></xref> describes a geometric shape.
**true** if this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.StreamGeometry"></xref> describes a geometry shape; otherwise, **false**.
Determines whether this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.StreamGeometry"></xref> contains a curved segment.
**true** if this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.StreamGeometry"></xref> object has a curved segment; otherwise, **false**.
Opens a <xref href="System.Windows.Media.StreamGeometryContext"></xref> that can be used to describe this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.StreamGeometry"></xref> object's contents.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Media.StreamGeometryContext"></xref> that can be used to describe this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.StreamGeometry"></xref> object's contents.
